radiographic_examinations.findings: Features of Langer mesomelic dysplasia, including severely shortened mesomelic bones, markedly curved radii, and hypoplastic distal ulnas and proximal fibulas.

Apparently normal findings in the sister, and findings indicative of LÃ©ri-Weill dyschondrosteosis (LWDC) such as bilateral mild radial curvature in the father, and bilateral moderate radial curvature, decreased carpal angle and distal radial angulation in the mother and grandmother.
Bilateral fibular exostosis in the father and mother, and left tibial exostosis in the grandmother.
